thread.title: Report: MLB To Get Rid Of Intentional Walks For 2017 Season
thread.title_full: Report: MLB To Get Rid Of Intentional Walks For 2017 Season

author: CBS Philly
title: Report: MLB To Get Rid Of Intentional Walks For 2017 Season
text:
Report: MLB To Get Rid Of Intentional Walks For 2017 Season February 21, 2017 9:21 PM By Ray Boyd Filed Under: mlb PHILADELPHIA, PA - MAY 08: Carlos Ruiz #51 of the Philadelphia Phillies signals for an intentional walk in the fourth inning at Citizens Bank Park on May 8, 2015 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.(Photo by Drew Hallowell/Getty Images) 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) — According to a CBSSports report , baseball commissioner Rob Manfred said that baseball would not be implementing significant rule changes in 2017 because of a lack of cooperation from the players union. 
According to an ESPN report, that claim may not be true and we could have seen Major League Baseball’s last intentional walk. Team and MLBPA sources are telling me baseball has approved a dugout signal for an intentional walk, effective for 2017 season. More coming. 
— Full Dissident (@hbryant42) February 22, 2017 
The change would reportedly replace the standard four way outside pitches with a single that comes in from the dugout. That would mean that baseball would eliminate what amounts to wasted time as four lobs are thrown down to the plate to bypass a batter.
